useCase.name: Low Battery
useCase.description: Most UAVs are equiped with Lithium polymer batteries (LiPo) - varying in terms of number of cells, voltage and capacity. Depending on the size, weight, and the payload a UAV is carrying, typical flying areas range from 15-40 minutes.

preconditions.precondition: The UAV is in the air and has a command and control link to one or more ground control stations.
A failsafe action has been pre-established to automatically activate RTL or land in place if the battery level drops below `[CRITICAL_BATTERY_THRESHOLD]`.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV is landed safely when the low battery warning occurs.
The UAV completes its mission as planned despite a low battery warning.

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV crashes or lands in an unsafe area.

useCase.trigger: The UAV is in flight and a low battery alarm is raised when the battery level is below `[LOW_BATTERY_THRESHOLD]`.

mainSequence.step: The runtime monitoring system detects a low battery event for the UAV.
The runtime monitoring system raises an alert.
The alert is displayed in the UI to notify the RPIC of the low battery warning for the UAV.
The UAV detects a battery level below `[CRITICAL_BATTERY_THRESHOLD]`.
The failsafe mechanism is activated according to the UAV's preconfiguration (e.g., RTL or land in place).
The RPIC maintains visual line of sight with the UAV and observes that it has transitioned to RTL state.
If necessary, the UAV suspends the remainder of the mission or manually moves other UAVs out of the way of the returning UAV.

esteps.description: The RPIC decides that the current task cannot be continued by the UAV.
esteps.step: The RPIC decides that the UAV cannot complete its designated task during the mission and is relieved from its task.
The RPIC manually activates RTL for the UAV.
DroneResponse provides an option to assign another UAV with the task.
The RPIC assigns a new UAV with the task, and the mission continues.

esteps.description: No failsafe mechanism has been established onboard the UAV.
esteps.step: The runtime monitoring system raises a critical battery alarm.
The RPIC immediately lands the UAV in place or manually activates RTL for the UAV.
